intro: Dimetia, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in pendulous clusters. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Dimetia grows as a deciduous shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
